message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.SI 

This paper proposes a statistical learning approach to predict political bias from text, using standard text features extracted from speeches and manifestos of political parties. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which are commonly used in the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The use of statistical learning also suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves information retrieval (cs.IR) in terms of extracting relevant features from text. Finally, the web application mentioned in the paper suggests a possible connection to social and information networks (cs.SI).
